MajorClaims.MC1: I agree that face-to-face communication is better
MajorClaims.MC2: I prefer to express my opinion in person
MajorClaims.MC3: the best way of communication is by means of face-to-face

Claims.C1: the advantages of this are qualitatively greater than that of the opposite
Claims.C2: we can commence to agree that communicating with someone in person is the best way
Claims.C3: we are capable of stating that it is important to talk to people face-to-face
Claims.C4: communication by letters, email, or telephone can enable them to talk without scruple, which is also one of the most important parts in communication

Premises.P1: communicating in person can be more convincing
Premises.P2: Sometimes, face-to face communication can lead us to convince or complain someone successfully, and a fitting example can be found from my uncle
Premises.P3: He once complained a service of a restaurant
Premises.P4: Without exaggeration, he directly went to the boss and told the boss that something wrong occurred on the meal--a fly concealed in it
Premises.P5: Afterward, my uncle acquired a new service thanks to face-to face communication
Premises.P6: If he just wrote something to complain on the website or by telephone, I do not think this problem would be thought important
Premises.P7: it is easy to be deceived without face-to face communication
Premises.P8: I had received some harmful words on facebook from my best friend, Eric
Premises.P9: He said that I was totally failed in building a good friendship and he did not want to be one of my friends anymore
Premises.P10: I just shocked and did not know what happened
Premises.P11: I realized that his facebook account was stolen
Premises.P12: It is conceivable that before we talk, it is necessary for us to be imprudent about our words
Premises.P13: Talking without scruple is not the indispensable part in communication; in contrast, it is usually detrimental to us
